poem:
Title: "A Penned Plea in Winter's Gestalt"

In the bleak midwinter, Britannia seeks retreat,
From self-wrought chains bound by Brexit's beat.
The ink of folly pours through the land,
Economic frostbite nipping at hands.
In the heart of the people, a cry unfurled,
Undone, we desire, this insular world.
For as holly and mistletoe under Yuletide's light,
Unity ever was our birthright.
